edu.nd.darts.cimon
Interface CimonInterface

All Superinterfaces:
IInterface
All Known Implementing Classes:
CimonInterface.Stub, CimonInterface.Stub.Proxy
public interface CimonInterface
extends IInterface

API provided for CIMON service. Applications which seek to incorporate CIMON services should include and build this aidl file with their project. Applications should bind to NDroidService, and use this interface to register and unregister monitoring requests with the service.

For periodic monitors and conditional monitors, the client will need to provide a Messenger to facilitate the update messages to the client with the periodic values. The client should implement a Handler to handle the periodic messages.

For event notification monitors, the client must provide a PendingIntent. The client may define what type of Intent they would prefer to use, to allow notifications during inactive times if needed. The client should implement and register a Receiver to handle the Intent message defined by the PendingIntent that will be used for notification of the event occurring.

For a list of all supported metrics and their associated integer reference, see Metrics.

For assistance in constructing event condition strings in the proper format, clients may include Conditions in their project, which provides some helper methods for constructing expression strings.

Author:
darts
See Also:
Metrics, Conditions, NDroidService

Parameters:

timeout - required freshness of value, in milliseconds. If currently cached value is within timeout bounds, cached value will be returned for most efficient execution.
Returns:

Throws:
RemoteException
See Also:
Metrics

registerPeriodic

int registerPeriodic(int metric,
                     long period,
                     long duration,
                     boolean eavesdrop,
                     Messenger callback)
                     throws RemoteException
Register a new periodic monitor. Periodic updates of the values will be provided using the Messenger, with the "what" field set to metric, and the object field set to the new value. Clients should implement a Handler to handle the updates from the Messenger. Data from the monitor will also be stored in a database. These records can be obtained from the CIMON Content Provider using the unique id returned from this call to filter the data table. Callback Messenger may be null to only store data in database with no callback.

For a list of all supported metrics, their associated integer reference, and the object type used for their values, see Metrics.

Parameters:
metric - integer representing metric (per Metrics) to monitor
period - period between updates (milliseconds), if eavesdrop is true this will represent the maximum allowable period between updates
duration - duration to monitor (in milliseconds), 0 for continuous
eavesdrop - if true, will provide updates as frequently as they are available due to any active monitors
callback - messenger for client callback handler to handle periodic updates
Returns:
unique id of registered monitor, -1 on failure (typically because metric is not supported on this system)
Throws:
RemoteException
See Also:
Metrics

unregisterPeriodic

void unregisterPeriodic(int metric,
                        int monitorId)
                        throws RemoteException
Unregister periodic monitor. Metric and unique monitorId will be used to identify the existing monitor to remove.

Parameters:
metric - integer representing metric (per Metrics) of registered monitor
monitorId - unique id of periodic monitor, returned by register registerPeriodic(int, long, long, boolean, Messenger)
Throws:
RemoteException
See Also:
registerPeriodic(int, long, long, boolean, Messenger)

registerEvent

int registerEvent(String expression,
                  long period,
                  PendingIntent callback)
                  throws RemoteException
Register a new event notification monitor. Client will be notified via the Intent defined by PendingIntent callback when the event occurs (when event expression evaluates to true). The client may define what type of Intent they would prefer to use, to allow notifications during inactive times if needed. The client should implement and register a Receiver to handle the Intent message defined by the PendingIntent that will be used for notification of the event occurring.

The expressions used for definition of events are boolean expressions which may contain one or multiple conditions. For assistance in constructing event condition strings in the proper format, clients may include Conditions in their project, which provides some helper methods for constructing expression strings.

Parameters:
expression - event condition string which defines event to monitor
period - maximum permitted period between condition state checks, in milliseconds
callback - PendingIntent that defines the Intent that client will handle to receive notification of an event trigger
Returns:
unique id of registered monitor, -1 on failure (typically because metric is not supported on this system)
Throws:
RemoteException
See Also:
Conditions

unregisterEvent

void unregisterEvent(int monitorId)
                     throws RemoteException
Unregister event notification monitor. Unique monitorId will be used to identify the existing monitor to remove.

Parameters:
monitorId - unique id of event notification monitor, from registerEvent(String, long, PendingIntent)
Throws:
RemoteException
See Also:
registerEvent(String, long, PendingIntent)

registerConditional

int registerConditional(int metric,
                        String expression,
                        long period,
                        Messenger callback)
                        throws RemoteException
Register conditional monitor. This is a hybrid of a periodic monitor and event notification monitor. This will monitor an event, as defined by an expression string, similar to an event notification monitor. When the expression evaluates to true, a periodic monitor will be activated for the metric and period requested. The periodic monitor will only be active while the expression string evaluates to true.

For a list of all supported metrics, their associated integer reference, and the object type used for their values, see Metrics.

The expressions used for definition of events are boolean expressions which may contain one or multiple conditions. For assistance in constructing event condition strings in the proper format, clients may include Conditions in their project, which provides some helper methods for constructing expression strings.

Parameters:
metric - integer representing metric (per Metrics) to monitor
expression - event condition string which defines condition when periodic monitor should be active
period - maximum permitted period between condition state checks, in milliseconds
callback - messenger for client callback handler to handle periodic updates
Returns:
unique id of registered monitor, -1 on failure (typically because metric is not supported on this system)
Throws:
RemoteException
See Also:
Metrics, Conditions

unregisterConditional

void unregisterConditional(int metric,
                           int monitorId)
                           throws RemoteException
Unregister conditional monitor. Metric and callback Messenger will be used to identify the existing monitor to remove.

Parameters:
metric - integer representing metric (per Metrics) of registered monitor
monitorId - unique id of conditional monitor, from registerConditional(int, String, long, Messenger)
Throws:
RemoteException
See Also:
registerConditional(int, String, long, Messenger)
